summary: Email correspondence between a prosecutor and FBI personnel regarding the status of evidence processing in the Epstein case, specifically tracking electronic devices seized from Epstein's properties. The email discusses a spreadsheet inventory of devices, confirms receipt of some drives, and notes others still being processed.

persons.name: Spwatson
persons.context: Listed as an FBI recipient (spwatson@fbi.gov) on the email chain regarding evidence status.

events.title: Evidence Status Update Email
events.description: Email exchange regarding the status of processing electronic evidence (drives/devices) seized in the Epstein investigation, confirming receipt of some items and noting others still being processed.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated July 23, 2020, concerning the status of electronic evidence in the Epstein case.
It references a detailed spreadsheet inventorying seized electronic devices, identified by NYC evidence numbers (e.g., NYC024328, NYC024367, NYC027910).
The email confirms receipt of some drives and notes that several others (NYC024376-380 and items in NYC024395) are still being processed by the FBI.
The document is marked as 'SUBJECT TO PROTECTIVE ORDER,' indicating restricted disclosure rules.
The correspondence is between a prosecutor (likely from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York) and FBI personnel, showing ongoing evidence management.
